references.paper_title: Model-agnostic meta-learning for fast adaptation of deep networks
references.reason: This paper introduces a foundational meta-learning algorithm, Model-Agnostic Meta-Learning (MAML), which is widely used and adapted in various few-shot learning scenarios.
This paper proposes a novel meta-learning approach that uses differentiable convex optimization, offering a more efficient and robust alternative to traditional meta-learning methods.
This paper presents a meta-learning method that leverages latent embedding optimization, improving generalization and performance in few-shot learning settings.

references.paper_title: Hypertransformer: Model generation for supervised and semi-supervised few-shot learning
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel hypertransformer architecture for few-shot learning, improving upon previous approaches by generating models tailored to specific tasks.

references.paper_title: Matching networks for one shot learning
references.reason: This paper introduces the Matching Networks model, a pioneering work in few-shot learning that uses a metric-based approach for classification.
